title: Community Health Notebook
text:
Community Health can be complex. The word “Community Health” sometimes means different things to different people. It can involve different departments and disciplines. It takes a huge inter-disciplinary effort to work towards Community Health.
Community Health as understood in the Indian Context largely involves the knowledge of both Public Health and General Practice Principles.
It can involve direct individual patient care at the primary and secondary care level. This includes the basic Out Patient clinic management of common diseases.
It can also also involve population level concepts like epidemiology nutrition, immunization, health policy, data management , health system strengthing and the like.
Regardless of one’s views on Community Health , the practice of Community Health usually involves a core skillset that can be used in various settings.
This website aims at creating a easy to use resource for all things Community Health.






Note



This website was made almost entirely using the Quarto package in the R Programming language (with some additional html and css styling.

title: community health notebook
text:
Dr Deepak Thomas Varughese
MBBS, MD Community Medicine, PGDip(Family Medicine), CCPPM(Pain and Palliative Medicine

Deepak is an Assistant Professor in Community Health. He completed his MD in Community Medicine as well as his Post Graduate Diploma in Family Medicine at the Christian Medical College, Vellore. He has experience and training in Pain and Palliative Medicine.
His current areas of research interest include Climate Change and Health as well as the use of Geographical Information Systems.
He is the founder of the website and started it in response to growing need among students for relevant up-to-date material in the study of Community Health.
